summary: the study was approved by the Institutional Review Board of the Beijing Center for Disease Control and Prevention. patients with pneumonia of unknown etiology in all hospitals were reported to the correspondent district CDC. samples were collected from wild birds in 317 parks and 10 wetland natural reserve regions in Beijing during may 3–10. samples were sent to district CDC laboratories for detection of influenza A(H7N9) virus. a total of 1,422 poultry workers were recruited into this surveillance study. 14 (0.98%) had ILI symptoms 2 weeks before recruitment. 3 samples from 2 other locations were positive for influenza A(H9N2) virus. human infections with avian influenza A(H7N9) virus can cause a wide spectrum of clinical illnesses. PCR is recommended for screening in sentinel hospital and laboratory-based surveillance of influenza A(H7N9).
